page.title: 07Morwenstow farming
page.content: Most farms here are medium sized hold- ings of about 200 acres. Farming is predominantly grass with a proportion being used for cereals. In summer some grass is cut to make hay and sileage for winter feeding. Some farmers keep sheep and cattle; others concentrate on milking. Machinery plays a very important part of farming in the 1980s and has become larger and more sophisticated as the years go by. Tractors are used most of all the machinery to do a variety of jobs by either pulling or lifting the implements behind them. Most farmers use a high proportion of artificial manure but still spread slurry and dung. Some farmers employ full-time workmen whereas others only employ part time. Usually a farmer's son will stay on the farm to work. Many farms now take in paying guests.
